alt: Curly-haired woman in pink sweater with her hands on her cheeks while she smiles brightly
name: Quartet Health
description: Quartet offers personalized care navigation services and connects individuals with mental health providers and resources to improve their overall well-being.

alt: the soceity for neurodiversity logo. a white background with the a big teal 'S', a yellow '4', a purple 'N', and a blue 'd' with the grey text 'Soceity for Neurodiversity' under the big multi-colored characters.
name: Society for Neurodiversity
description: S4Nd’s peer support groups are run by and for neurodiverse people. The groups offer members mutual support, guidance and the sharing of information. All S4Nd peer support groups are open to anyone who identifies as neurodiverse.

alt: a graphic design with a forest green background and the white text 'you deserve to be happy' at the top of the picture. below that is the question 'what type of therapy are you looking for?' in white text. under that question are three options in the form of a light green box that says 'individual, for myself' and has a graphic design woman sitting at a desk with a plant on it, a blue box that says 'couples, for me and my partner that' and has a two people hugging, and lastly an oragen box that says 'teen, for my child' that has a younger looking graphic deisgn person sitting on the ground
name: Better Help
description: BetterHelp is an online therapy platform that provides accessible mental health services to individuals seeking support for various concerns such as depression, anxiety, relationship issues, etc. Therapy is offered through messaging, live chat, phone calls, and video sessions, allowing users to communicate with licensed therapists at their own pace and convenience.

alt: meetup logo. white background with pink text that says 'meet up'
name: Meetup
description: Meet other local people interested in neurodiversity and disabilities: share experiences, inspire and encourage each other! Join a neurodiversity and or disability group.
